edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.Assignment2

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.Assignment2.Character
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    House, Player

    public abstract class Character
extends Object
    Author:
    David Scianni. The Character class is an abstract class that keeps track of the Character's money, their hand, and the current amount of cards in their hand, currentCardCount. It also has an abstract printHand() method that determines how its subclasses will print their hand.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int currentCardCount
      currentCardCount keeps track of how many cards the Character currently has in its hand.
      protected Card[] hand
      hand is an array of type Card.
      private int money
      The money variable determines the amount of money the Character owns.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Character(int m)
      The Character constructor takes in a parameter m, and sets money to that integer.

      This is used to send the currentCardCount of the Character's hand.

      The hasAce method will check every card in the Character's hand and see if there is an AceCard in it.

      This is called when the character has lost a bet and will subtract money by m.
      void newHand()
      The newHand method will reset the hand, making it a new array of size 5.

      This abstract method will print out the Character's hand depending on which subclass calls it.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • money

        private int money
        The money variable determines the amount of money the Character owns.

      • hand

        protected Card[] hand
        hand is an array of type Card. This is the set of cards that the Character currently has in its possession. It is protected because its subclasses need to call this variable at certain times.

      • currentCardCount

        protected int currentCardCount
        currentCardCount keeps track of how many cards the Character currently has in its hand. It is protected because its subclasses need to call this variable at certain times.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Character

        public Character(int m)
        The Character constructor takes in a parameter m, and sets money to that integer. It also instantiates hand as a Card array of size 5. it also sets the currentCardCount to 0 since the Character has no cards in its hand.
        Parameters:
        m - is the amount of money the Character starts off with.

    • Method Detail

      • getMoney

        public int getMoney()
        This will send the amount of money that the Character currently has. This can be used for determining whether the Character has enough money to bet, or if they have won/lost the game.
        Returns:
        the amount of money the Character has.

      • getCard

        public Card getCard(int i)
        This method is used to send the Card that is in the i position of the Character's hand.
        Parameters:
        i - is the position in hand of the Card to be returned.
        Returns:
        the Card inside hand[i]

      • getCurrentCardCount

        public int getCurrentCardCount()
        This is used to send the currentCardCount of the Character's hand. It can be used to check where to add a new card, or whether or not they have 5 cards in their hand already.
        Returns:
        the currentCardCount of the Character.

      • addCard

        public void addCard(Card c)
        This will recieve a Card and put it into the next available slot in the array hand. It will also increase the currentCardCount by 1.
        Parameters:
        c - is the Card that is to be added to the hand

      • loseMoney

        public void loseMoney(int m)
        This is called when the character has lost a bet and will subtract money by m.
        Parameters:
        m - is the amount of money the Character lost.

      • winMoney

        public void winMoney(int m)
        This is called when the character has won a bet and will add money by m
        Parameters:
        m - is the amount of money the Character has won

      • newHand

        public void newHand()
        The newHand method will reset the hand, making it a new array of size 5. It will also reset the currentCardCount to 0. This is used when a round is over and the player needs a new hand.

      • hasAce

        public int hasAce()
        The hasAce method will check every card in the Character's hand and see if there is an AceCard in it. If there is, it will return the position of the AceCard. If there is no AceCard, then it returns a -1.
        Returns:
        either the location of the AceCard or a -1 if no AceCard exists in hand

      • printHand

        public abstract void printHand()
        This abstract method will print out the Character's hand depending on which subclass calls it. If the Player class calls this method, it will print out each card in its hand in a graphical way, i.e. |Ad| |Kh|. If the House class calls the method, it will print the same as Player, but will also display the current amount of money that the house has in its pot. Both classes will check to see how many cards are in their hand, and will display that many cards on the screen.
